meanings.definition: To surpass in pity or compassion.
meanings.sent1: She outpitied her friend when she saw the injured puppy.
meanings.sent2: He always outpitied others and offered help whenever he could.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outpitied her brother when he fell off his bike, making him feel better.
meanings.sent4: Her heart outpitied the sorrowful tale, feeling deeply for the characters' struggles.
meanings.sent5: The kind old man outpitied everyone in the village, always lending a helping hand.

meanings.definition: To have more pity or compassion than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The teacher outpitied the students who were struggling with their assignments.
meanings.sent2: She outpitied her sister's disappointment and tried to cheer her up.
meanings.sent3: The cat outpitied the dog when it couldn't reach its favorite toy, offering it a different one to play with.
meanings.sent4: His empathy outpitied all others, making him the most compassionate person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The nurse outpitied the patients, always going above and beyond to make them feel comfortable.
